title: Substituting $$x$$
text: For all instances of $$x$$, replace with $$\frac{x+1}{x-2}$$: $$3{\left(\frac{x+1}{x-2}\right)}^2+\frac{x+1}{x-2}+1$$

title: Finding the Least Common Denominator
text: To simplify the equation further, the terms can be added together by finding the least common denominator and then multiplying each term such that each term is over the same denominator.
speech: To simplify the equation further, the terms can be added together by finding the least common denominator and then multiplying each term such that each term is over the same denominator.

title: Adding the Terms
text: Add up $$3x^2+6x+3$$, $$x^2-x-2$$, and $$x^2-4x+4$$ by combining like terms to get the numerator of the final result. Remember that the denominator is $${\left(x-2\right)}^2$$.
